kdl.prox.nsi2.apps
Class Clustering

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.nsi2.apps.Clustering

public class Clustering
extends java.lang.Object

The Clustering class consists of various methods to cluster a graph. The two major clustering techniques are kmeans and betweenness components, which are made tractable by the use of NSIs.

Method Detail

kmeans

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> kmeans(int k,
                                                                                        NSI distAss,
                                                                                        NSI distCent,
                                                                                        int iterationMax)
Performs k-medoids using NSIs for distance approximation. NB: If actual searching is desired, use the SearchNSI with the desired search method.

Parameters:
k - Number of clusters
distAss - NSI to use for estimating distances in assigning nodes to clusters
distCent - NSI to use for estimating distances in recomuputing centroid/medoids
iterationMax - Maximum number of iterations to perform
Returns:
Map corresponding to clusters: centroidId --> cluster members (List)

reviseClustersModal

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> reviseClustersModal(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> centroidToCluster,
                                                                                                     Graph graph)
Performs modal cluster reassignment after an initial clustering.

Parameters:
centroidToCluster - Map corresponding to an initial clustering: centroidId --> cluster members (List)
graph - Graph abstraction (e.g., InMemoryGraph), needed to find neighbors of nodes
Returns:
Map corresponding to revised clusters: centroidId --> cluster members (List)

toNST

public static NST toNST(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer>> clusters)
Convert a clustering result in a map to an NST.

Parameters:
clusters - Map corresponding to an initial clustering: centroidId --> cluster members (Collection)
Returns:
An NST corresponding to the clustering. Will have two columns: id, centroid

toNST

public static NST toNST(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer>> clusters,
                        NSI nsi)
Convert a clustering result in a map to an NST, adds distance to centroid for each node if nsi is specified.

Parameters:
clusters - Map corresponding to an initial clustering: centroidId --> cluster members (Collection)
nsi - NSI used to estimate each nodes distance to its respective centroid. If null, will not add distance to the resulting NST
Returns:
An NST corresponding to the clustering. Will have three columns: id, centroid, dist. If nsi is null, NST will only consist of the first two columns.

clusterListsFromNST

public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> clusterListsFromNST(NST idclust)
Converts an NST corresponding to a clustering of nodes into a list of lists for each cluster

Parameters:
idclust - NST with two columns: id, cluster
Returns:
A list of lists for each cluster of nodes

betweennessComponents

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> betweennessComponents(int k,
                                                                                                       Search search,
                                                                                                       int num)
Performs clustering by computing link betweenness centrality, and iteratively removing the most central link and finding the connected components.

Parameters:
k - Number of clusters
search - Search method used to estimate link betweenness centrality. NB: Search method must be able to return paths. Breadth-first cannot be used.
num - Number of searches to use for betweenness estimation.
Returns:
Map corresponding to clusters: centroidId --> cluster members (List), here centroid is chosen arbitrarily

betweennessComponentsRecalc

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> betweennessComponentsRecalc(int k,
                                                                                                             Search search,
                                                                                                             int num)
Performs clustering by iteratively computing link betweenness centrality, removing the most central link and finding the connected components. This method should be used instead of betweennessComponents. The betweenness estimates here are more accurate since they are recomputed each iteration.

Parameters:
k - Number of clusters
search - Search method used to estimate link betweenness centrality. NB: Search method must be able to return paths. Breadth-first cannot be used.
num - Number of searches to use for betweenness estimation.
Returns:
Map corresponding to clusters: centroidId --> cluster members (List), here centroid is chosen arbitrarily

                                            int outCount,
                                            NST clustersOldNST,
                                            java.util.Random r)

pairwiseAccuracy

                                        NST clustersNewNST)

                                        int outCount,
                                        NST clustersOldNST,
                                        NST clustersNewNST,
                                        java.util.Random r)
